level.heading: DEFINTIONS (§ 15-2699) The following words and terms, when used in this Chapter, shall have theollowing definitions unless the context clearly states otherwise: “Approved agreement” means an agreement approved by the Commissionursuant to Section 252 of the Telecommunications Act of 1996, D.C. Code, 2001d. § 34-2002(h) and Section 2604. “Arbitrating party” means one of the telecommunications carriersarticipating in the arbitration proceeding. “Arbitration agreement” means the agreement or amended agreementeached by the arbitrating parties pursuant to the arbitration decision. “Arbitration decision” means the signed decision of the arbitratorr the arbitration panel. “Arbitration petition” means a petition filed by aelecommunications carrier requesting the Commission for arbitration pursuant to7 U.S.C. § 252(b). “Commission” means the Public Service Commission of the District ofolumbia. “Commission’s procedural rules” means the Commission’sules of Practice and Procedure that are contained in Chapter 1 of Title 15CMR. “Days” means calendar days, unless otherwise specified. “Enforcement petition” means a petition to enforce an approvedgreement. “Ex parte communication” means an oral or written communicationetween the arbitrator and a telecommunications carrier’s representativeelating to the merits of the proceeding, which is made without providing allther telecommunications carriers participating in the arbitration proceedinghe opportunity to participate. “Incumbent local exchange carrier” means, with respect to an area,he local exchange carrier that provided local exchange service in such an arean the date of enactment of the federal. Telecommunications Act of 1996 (P.L.04-104). “Interpretation petition” means a petition filed to interpret anpproved agreement. “Interpretation or enforcement decision” means a signed decision ofhe Commission’s agent in an interpretation or enforcement proceeding. “Interpretation or enforcement proceeding” means a proceeding inhich the Commission interprets or enforces an approved agreement. “Local exchange carrier” means any person or entity that is engagedn the provision of telephone exchange service or exchange access. The term doesot include a person or entity insofar as the person or entity is engaged in therovision of commercial mobile service. “Mediating party” means a party participating in mediation. “Negotiated agreement” means an agreement or amended agreementetween a telecommunications carrier and an incumbent local exchange carrierursuant to 47 U.S.C. § 252 arrived at through voluntary negotiation orediation. A negotiated agreement includes an interconnection agreement that waspted into by telecommunications service providers either in the District ofolumbia or another jurisdiction. “Party” means a person, entity, individual, corporation,artnership, or association. “Petitioning carrier” means a telecommunications carrier that files request for arbitration pursuant to 47 U.S.C. § 252(b) or that files aetition for enforcement and interpretation of an approved agreement. “Requesting carrier” means a telecommunications carrier that files aequest for mediation pursuant to 47 U.S.C. § 252(a)(2). “Responding carrier” means a telecommunications carrier thatesponds to a request for mediation or an arbitration, enforcement, ornterpretation petition. “Telecommunications” means the transmission, between or among pointspecified by the user, of information of the user’s choosing, withouthange in the form or content of the information as sent and received. “Telecommunications carrier” means any provider ofelecommunications services, except that the term does not include aggregatorsf telecommunications services as defined in 47 U.S.C. § 226. “Telecommunications service” means the offering ofelecommunications for a fee directly to the public or to such classes of userss to be effectively available to the public, regardless of the facilities used.
SOURCE
